channel.title: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)
channel.description: Well, my computer (Win XP) Sometimes just randomly shuts off (doesnt shut down) and turns right back on. Its completley random some times it could be an hour sometimes a lil while afterwards. I know its not a virus because yesterday it did it and i reset my computer. Can someone help me.

item.title: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Payback Is A Bitch:

Guys don’t worry about it, it stopped.

Just so you know, if its a memory failure it will restart when the pc starts geting busy.

Read full topic

item.title: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:47, topic:201433”]When I had RAM issues, my PC froze. It didn’t shut off randomly.
When my PSU failed on my Dell, it shut off.[/quote]

Good for you. Something happening to you once does not mean it’s the case every single time.

item.title: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I HAD THIS EXACT PROBLEM! It was my memory, comlpeted busted… Do a memcheck it is probably your problems. Send your RAM back to wherever you got it from, it fixed it for me

P.S. When i ran memtesk i had over 370 errors ftl.

Read full topic

item.title: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)

[quote=“Mopman, post:46, topic:201433”]Uhh… uhhh…

When I had RAM issues, my PC froze. It didn’t shut off randomly.

When my PSU failed on my Dell, it shut off.

item.title: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:19, topic:201433”][quote author=Payback Is A Bitch link=topic=266093.msg2199347#msg2199347 date=1208680359]

Actually, that brings up another point. How did you touch the ram when you placed it into the computer? Because if you’re not careful you could discharge static, which could cause the RAM to fail. This is a symptom of faulty RAM. Now I’m not saying you need to go out and buy new RAM to replace it. But you should look into doing some System Checks, and things. To possibly find out what the problem is exactly.

I used rubber gloves.
[/quote]
I checked back to this thread and it sounds like one of two things:
Your molesting your computer.
You obviously fucked with it, so you maybe had it coming.

Dont find out your computer is broke, fuck with it, then break it even more, then ask for help, it avoids the warranty.[/quote]

Isn’t it ‘void’?

Read full topic

item.title: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:22, topic:201433”][quote author=Payback Is A Bitch link=topic=266093.msg2199354#msg2199354 date=1208680579]

Actually, that brings up another point. How did you touch the ram when you placed it into the computer? Because if you’re not careful you could discharge static, which could cause the RAM to fail. This is a symptom of faulty RAM. Now I’m not saying you need to go out and buy new RAM to replace it. But you should look into doing some System Checks, and things. To possibly find out what the problem is exactly.

I used rubber gloves.

I checked back to this thread and it sounds like one of two things:
Your molesting your computer.
You obviously fucked with it, so you maybe had it coming.

Dont find out your computer is broke, fuck with it, then break it even more, then ask for help, it avoids the warranty.

Yes I fucked up my computer by Upgrading it. Damn your good.
[/quote]
I win, cookie pls.[/quote]
No, fuck off.

Read full topic
item.source: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)

item.title: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah

item.source: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)

item.title: My computer just randomly shuts off (not shuts down)
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:34, topic:201433”][quote author=Payback Is A Bitch link=topic=266093.msg2199392#msg2199392 date=1208682187]
Idk, if it keeps on I’ll take it somewhere and get it fixed this comp is from 02 (upgraded alot) but i think i need a new one.
[/quote]

No. Don’t take it anywhere to get it fixed, especially not from a place like Geek Squad. Get a geeky friend that you trust.

Or replace the PSU.

And when did I say this was standby? Please, read the post carefully. This happens to me when the computer is perfectly on and with the screen saver. It goes off and then turns back on within a few seconds. Unless his completly shuts down and takes reboot time…mine just automatiaclly opens.

You just described standby, you faggot.[/quote]
No need for flaming. I have never put my computer on standby so how do I no it’s that?

Read full topic

Unless his completly shuts down and takes reboot time…mine just automatiaclly opens.[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:31, topic:201433”][quote author=pk4pk link=topic=266093.msg2199389#msg2199389 date=1208682017]
This happens to me. No need to worry…it just goes black and the opens right back up again right? If so this is the way of the computer trying to get you to turn it off to conceal energy…it usually happens after an hour of afk. At least for me thats what happens.
